Welcome to eqnfree’s documentation!¶

eqnfree.eqfm module¶

Module for equation-free modeling and analysis @author: Paul Petersik

class eqnfree.eqfm.eqfModel(micro_model, micro_model_parameters, initial_micro_state, initial_macro_state)¶

Bases: object

The main class for the equation free modeling

bifurcation_analysis(bifurcation_parameter, bifurcation_macro_state, n_fixed_points, dmacro=0.1, dparameter=0.1, s=1.0, parameter_direction=1.0, nu=1.0, ref_tmax=1000.0, rerun=False, save_for_rerun=True)¶
Parameters:
  • bifurcation_parameter (str) – Model parameter for the bifurcation analysis
  • bifurcation_macro_state (str) – Macroscopic state in which the bifurcation analysis should be performed
  • n_fixed_points (int) – Number of fixed points to be found
  • dmacro (float) – finite difference in the macroscopic state for computation of derivatives
  • dparameter (float) – finite difference in the model parameter for computation of derivatives
  • parameter_direction (float) – step size and direction (by the sign of the step size) for computing a second reference state
  • s (float) – extrapolation factor for finding predicting the next fixed point
  • nu (float) – the fraction for which the Newton step in the corrector step is applied (default nu=1 is a full newton step)
  • ref_tmax (float) – integration time for reference state
  • rerun (bool) – start a bifurcation analysis with saved reference and beginning at the last saved fixed point
compute_macro_time_stepper(macro_state_init)¶

macroscopic timestepper

compute_reference()¶

Compute a reference microscopic state

explicit_time_stepper(macro_state_init)¶

compute time stepper explicitly

implicit_time_stepper(macro_state_init)¶

compute time stepper implicitly

Parameters:macro_state_init (dict) – initial macroscopic state to start evolution of the micro model
projective_integration(Delta_t, iterations, macro_state_name, dmacro=0.1, verbose=True)¶

coarse time stepper using extrapolation of the macropscopic state from the microscopic model

Parameters:
  • Delta_t (float) – the extrapolation time step
  • iterations (int) – number of iterations
  • macro_state_name (str) – name of the macroscopic state for which the projective integration should be done
  • dmacro (float) – the finite difference in the macroscopic state to compute the derivatives with respect to the macroscopic state (default: 0.1)
  • verbose (bool) – print the macroscopic state to the console
save_fixed_points()¶

Save fixed points to a csv file

save_reference()¶

Save fixed points to a NPY file

setEqfmOperators(lifitng_operator, evolution_operator, restriction_operator)¶

Set the three Operators for the equation-free modeling. The operators need to be provided in a certain structure. In particular, the argument names are just allowed if they are specified in a certain manner and the operators need to return python dictionaries.

Parameters:lifitng_operator – The lifting operator that maps a macroscopic state into a microscopic state.

The arguments of the lifting operator names(!) must be (self, new_macro_state, new_micro_model_parameters). :param evolution_operator: The evolution operator that integrates the microscopic model in time. :param restriction_operator: The restriction operator that maps a microscopic state to the macroscopic state.

static state(variable_names, dimension)¶

This method helps to initialize a dictionary that can be used in a stateObject.

Parameters:
  • variable_names (list) – List of variable names.
  • dimension (int) – Dimension of the variables.

eqnfree._private.stateObject module¶

Created on Thu Dec 27 18:31:27 2018

@author: paul

class eqnfree._private.stateObject.stateObject(category, purpose, keys, data=None)¶

Bases: object

Holds the values for the micro, macro or parameter state of a equation-free model. The state values can be hold for 2 purposes either for a reference case (“ref”) or for a temporary case (“tmp”). Furthermore, the category of a state can be either “micro”,”macro” or”parameters” refering to microscopic, macroscopic and parameter state.

load(index=None)¶

Loads data from previous runs that where saved using the method stateObject.save()

Parameters:index (int) – If the category of a stateObject is “tmp” an index has to be provided for which the data should be loaded.
save(index=None)¶

Saves the data dictionary to a NPY-file to a distinct location.

Parameters:index (int) – The index of the current time step for which the data should be saved.
